documents.title: european markets close higher
text: the prospect of stimulus measures such as qe by the european central bank , as floated by mario draghi in the us on friday , has continued to support markets .
european markets recovered ground after an early dip while the ftse 100 played catch up after monday 's bank holiday to reach a seven week high ( details in nick fletcher 's closing market report ) .
sentiment was also helped by better than expected us consumer confidence and durable goods figures , while the collapse of the french government caused few ripples .
hopes of easing tensions in the ukraine as well as gaza was the icing on the cake .

so the closing scores showed : the ftse 100 finished up 47.76 points or 0.7 % at 6822.76 germany 's dax rose 0.82 % to 9588.15 france 's cac closed 1.18 % better at 4393.41 italy 's ftse mib added 1.33 % to 20,645.54 spain 's ibex ended 1.28 % higher at 10,826.9 on wall street the dow jones industrial average is currently 0.34 % or 57 points higher while the s & p 500 has hit yet another new high of 2003 .
on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments and we 'll be back again tomorrow .

text: sir martin sorrell , chief executive officer of wpp .

/bloomberg via getty images time to recap , i think one of britain 's top businesspeople has warned that the scottish independence vote , and the upcoming uk referendum on european union membership , are grey swan '' risks to the recovery .
sir martin sorrell argued this morning that : there is all to play for as we go into the election .
obviously it does increase uncertainty in the uk , it 's not good .
[ the question of ] what is our position in relation to the european market , to the eu ? ''
is an added uncertainty .
sorrell also declared that geopolitical tensions in russia , and the middle east , has elbowed the eurozone down the list of biggest worries for business leaders .
the eurozone was the big topic of conversation and concern this time last year .
this year it 's been replaced by the middle east , and in particular by russia and the impact of sanctions .
us consumers do n't appear to be too concerned .
consumer confidence has hit its highest level since october 2007 , the autumn of the credit crunch .
burger king has confirmed that it is acquiring canadian coffee chain tim hortons in an $ 11bn deal .
full story here .
the move has prompted a backlash from some customers , who fear burger king will use the acquisition to cut its tax bill .
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) people are going ballistic on burger king 's facebook page the other economic news from america is more mixed .

but house price growth is stalling .

the ftse 100 is up 40 points , or 0.6 % , in late trading .
the french and german markets are also up again , adding to monday 's gains .
bond prices also strengthened , pushing yields on german , spanish and italian sovereign debt even lower .
while in greece , a new 'code of ethics ' has been agreed to tackle its mountain of bad debts .
the oecd has reported that advanced economies grew by just 0.4 % in the second quarter of 2014 , led by the us and uk .

documents.title: burger king backlash
text: burger king 's decision to buy canada 's tim hortons for $ 11.4bn has gone down badly with some customers , who are unhappy that the fast food chain could shift its tax base to canada .
thanks to the magic of social media , you can see the outrage unfolding on burger king 's facebook page .
this post summed up the mood : i pay my taxes and expect companies to do the same .
if bk leaves the us to avoid taxes then i will never spend another dollar there !
senator sherrod brown has already suggested that customers should boycott burger king if it inverts its tax base .

one facebooker wants the senate to go further : as a veteran i encourage you to sponsor a bill that shuts down every single burger king located on an american military installation in the u.s burger king management , meanwhile , insist that they 're not being driven by the prospect of lower tax bills ( perish the very thought , children ) simon neville ( @ simonneville ) on burger king / tim hortons conference call , bosses say : `` this is a strategic transaction and is not being driven by tax rates . ''
that may not quieten these critics : joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) people are going ballistic on burger king 's facebook page

documents.title: us consumer confidence hits highest level since october 2007
text: us consumer morale has surged to its highest level since the early days of the financial crisis .
the monthly survey of us consumer confidence has just smashed expectations by jumping to 92.4 for august .
that 's the highest reading since october 2007 , up from 90.3 in july , according to the confidence board 's report .
markit economics ( @ markiteconomics ) conference board 's us consumer confidence index at +92.4 in august .

up from +90.3 and beats tr consensus of +89.0 marketwatch economy ( @ mktweconomics ) plans to buy a car was highest since march the report includes signs that the labor market up this month , with people reporting it was easier to find new jobs .

michael mckee ( @ mckonomy ) for august jobs , note confidence report shows jobs `` plentiful '' up to 18.2 % from 15.6 % , jobs `` hard to get '' declines to 30.6 % from 30.9 % some caution is needed , though - other consumer confidence surveys have been less bullish recently , as this chart shows : michael mcdonough ( @ m mcdonough ) conference board 's consumer confidence measure is bucking the trend :
capital economics are n't getting carried away by the surge in us durable goods orders , thanks to that spike in aircraft sales .
they caution : july 's spectacular durable goods orders provide a misleadingly strong signal on the strength of the economy , although the outlook for business investment is improving .
steve feiss ( @ stevefeiss ) barclays visual on housing .

documents.title: us house prices fall
text: us s & p/case shiller housing report , to june 2014 photograph : /s & p/case shiller the latest survey of us house prices has just hit the wires , and shows an unexpected dip in prices in june - suggesting the market may be losing steam .
the s & p/case shiller index of 20 metropolitan areas showed the average family home price fell 0.2 % month-on-month , seasonally adjusted .
economists had expected a flat reading .
on an unadjusted basis , prices at these 20 areas rose by 1 % .
nationally , prices fell by 0.1 % on a seasonally adjusted basis .
year-on-year , prices are up by 6.2 % across america , but there are signs that the rally is petering out , as the us federal reserve moves closer to normalising monetary policy .
s & p dow jones indices , which compiles the report , says it shows a sustained slowdown in price increases . ''
david blitzer , chairman of the index committee at s & p dow jones indices , explains : home price gains continue to ease as they have since last fall .
the monthly national index rose 0.9 % in june .
while all 20 cities saw higher home prices over the last 12 months , all experienced slower gains .
in san francisco , the pace of price increases halved since late last summer .
the sun belt cities - las vegas , phoenix , miami and tampa - all remain a third or more below their peak prices set almost a decade ago . ''
in contrast , the average uk house price is now above its pre-crisis peak .

blitzer warns that the prospect of rising us interest rates will weigh on the market : bargain basement mortgage rates wo n't continue forever ; recent improvements in the labor markets and comments from fed chair janet yellen and others hint that interest rates could rise as soon as the first quarter of 2015 .
rising mortgage rates wo n't send housing into a tailspin , but will further dampen price gains . ''
conor sen ( @ conorsen ) re : case-shiller , locally the housing market has slowed notably since mid-june .
new construction in my neighborhood no longer selling .
the record-breaking durable goods survey also shows a 318 % spike in demand for civilian planes .
so why did aircraft orders shoot up so much last month ?
well , as fastft points out , july was the month of the farnborough airshow .
the diplomatic spat between russia and the uk , which saw its delegation recalled home , dominated attention .
but behind the scenes , us aerospace firms must have been racking up the orders .
a boeing 787 dreamliner sits on the assembly line at the boeing factory in everett , washington .

documents.title: us durable goods orders rise by record 22.6 %
text: just in : orders for us durable goods have soared by a record amount , and it 's all thanks to increased demand for aircraft .
durable goods orders surged by 22.6 % in july , smashing expectations of a 7.5 % rise .
strip out transportation orders , though , and orders for durable goods ( items designed to last at least three years ) fell by 0.8 % .
june 's durable goods report has been revised higher , to +2.7 % from +0.7 % originally .

documents.title: burger king seals deal to buy tim hortons
text: kilpatrick/ap it 's official : us fast food chain burger king is merging with canadian coffee and doughnut chain tim hortons .
the deal will create the world 's third-largest quick service '' restaurant company , more than 18,000 restaurants turning over a whopping $ 23bn of sales .
the two companies will maintain the current global homes '' in oakville and miami respectively once the deal goes though .
the merger is controversial , though - it could allow burger king cut its tax bills by shifting its tax domicile to canada , where corporation tax is lower .
burger king 's majority owners , 3g capital , have agreed to pay $ 94.05 canadian dollars per share for tim hortons , in cash and shares .
tim hortons shares were worth around c $ 67 last week , before news of a possible deal broke .
warren buffett has a part to play in the deal too - his berkshire hathaway investment group is providing $ 3bn of financing .
and tim hortons has reassured staff that there will be no changes to 'restaurant level ' employment .

documents.title: uk housing market in focus
text: there 's a flurry of new data on the uk housing market today .
first up , the number of new mortgages approved by lenders dipped last month to 42,792 , below the recent average .
but the average loan value increased , from £ 163,800 in june to £ 167,600 in july - as prices kept rising .
more here : small dip in july mortgage approvals offset by increase in average value secondly , estate agent savills has revised up its forecasts for price growth .
it now expects average annual uk house price growth of 9.5 % this year , ahead of the 6.5 % originally forecast .
savills also acknowledged that london 's property boom has taken it by surprise .
it originally expected price growth of 8.5 % this year - now upgraded to 15 % .
but over the next five years , average uk prices should slightly outpace the capital , it reckons , growing by 25 % : uk house price forecasts , 2014-2018 photograph : /savills

documents.title: irish jobless rate drops to 11.5 %
text: ireland 's unemployment rate has hit its lowest level since the financial crisis struck the celtic tiger , as more people find work , and more people left the labour force altogether .
the jobless rate across the republic fell to 11.5 % in the april-june quarter , the central statistics office reported .
employment is up by 1.7 % over the last year , with 31,600 more people finding work .
and the number of unemployed people dropped by 46,200 , taking the total to 254,500 .
the total labour force has contracted too , by 14,500 .

documents.title: oecd : advanced economies grew 0.4 % in last quarter
text: growth has up in the world 's major developed economies , with the uk and us making up for the weakness of japan and the eurozone .
that 's according to a new report from the organisation for economic co-operation and development reports .
it says gdp across the 33 countries who make up the oecd area rose by 0.4 % in april-june , up from 0.2 % in january-march .
there was a wide spectrum of patterns across countries '' , though .
real quarterly growth in the us surged by 1 % , followed by britain with 0.8 % .
japan contracted by 1.7 % as a new sales tax hit spending , germany shrank by 0.2 % and france was flat .

documents.title: south africa avoids recession
text: south africa 's economy has returned to growth , avoiding a new recession , but not expanding as fast as hoped .
statistics south africa reports that the country 's gdp rose by 0.6 % in the second quarter of 2014 , reversing the 0.6 % contraction recorded in january-march .
economists had predicted growth of 0.9 % .
mohammed nalla ( @ mohammednalla ) # sa # gdp prints 0.6 % q/q below consensus 0.9 % .
1.0 % y/y below consensus at 1.2 % .
no # recession but a terrible number showing a sick # economy on an annual basis , gdp is up by 1 % , compared to 1.6 % in the previous quarter , indicating a slowdown .

documents.title: greece agrees new ethics code for bad bank loans
text: people waiting at a bus stop opposite the greek parliament in central athens yesterday .
konstantinidis/reuters over to greece where the debt-stricken country 's central bank has devised a new code of ethics '' to deal with the ever worsening problem of non performing loans .
our correspondent helena smith reports from athens : it 's a problem that has mirrored greece 's seemingly never ending debt crisis : the issue of non performing loans .

with some 35 % of all lender loans no longer being serviced , the country 's central bank reckons that an estimated €75bn in total is currently owed to banks , among the largest amounts in global financial history and for a nation off just over 11 million proportionately by far the largest in the eu .
it 's the biggest headache for our banking system and a major drain on our ability to provide credit , '' said one banker requesting anonymity .
the new code has been a priority over the summer . ''

ahead of eu-wide stress tests in october , greece 's central bank has now devised a new code ( yet to be fine-tuned ) that reportedly allows 'compromise solutions ' to be found for lenders and debtors .

rubber-stamped by the committee of credit and insurance matters on monday the code , say insiders , foresees haircuts '' being extended to loans , revisions on interest repayments , the conversion of mortgages into rental contracts and the voluntary return of properties to banks ( a way for lenders not to be seen to be forcibly requisitioning assets ) .

foreclosures will be activated if mortgage borrowers are seen to be deliberately uncooperative - with the collapse of property prices many greeks , hit by austerity measures , simply gave up on repayments as the crisis intensified .
such steps have been taken in other [ eu ] countries to handle non performing loans .
frankly we 've dragged our feet .
it 's in no one 's interest to have this hanging , '' said the banker .
all round this should be a relief . ''

former finance minister yannis stournaras who assumed the post of governor of the bank of greece earlier this summer , is believed to be pushing hard for the code of ethics to be applied before the stress tests later this year .
bankers have not hidden their concerns that greek lenders may need big capital injections to survive ( despite huge injections received so far ) following the tests .

documents.title: strong pound hits wpp and bunzl
text: as if all these grey swans were n't bad enough , wpp is also suffering from the strong pound .
the ad company said its revenues had been ravaged '' by the strength of sterling ( which meant that overseas revenues were worth less when converted into pounds ) .
bunzl , the distribution and outsourcing group , had a similar tale for the city this morning , saying the strong pound has significantly decreased '' its growth .
humphreys/pa
sorry , i should have explained what sorrell means by saying scottish independence and britain 's potential exit from the eu are 'grey swan ' risks .

he 's harking back to nassim taleb 's black swan '' theory , which argued that financial markets ( and the rest of us ) fail to predict certain events because they fall outside previous experience so ca n't be anticipated , even though they have seismic consequences .
a grey swan , in sorrell 's terms , is a known unknowns '' - an event that can be predicted , but whose impact is unclear .
other grey swans include the weak eurozone economy , and the prospect of a 'hard landing ' in china , or the wider developing economies .

martin sorrell has also voiced his concerns about scottish independence to the bbc : ben thompson ( @ bbcbenthompson ) sir martin sorrell at @ twitterid tells me that 'uncertainty is not good for business and regardless of yes/no vote , firms need to plan ' @ twitterid ben thompson ( @ bbcbenthompson ) martin sorrell warns 'in a world of geopolitical challenges , scotland voting for independence could cause firms to delay investment plans '

documents.title: sorrell : scottish independence and brexit are grey swan threats
text: sir martin sorrell has also warned that the prospects of scotland voting for independence , and britain leaving the european union , could both threaten the uk economy .
the head of advertising giant wpp told reuters this morning that these issues are grey swans '' that could disrupt the recovery .
tns , which is wpp 's polling arm , currently has the no to independence '' vote leading , but the number of 'do n't knows ' is larger than the gap that the yes side needs to scale .
and with alex salmond winning last night 's debate with alistair darling , the vote could still be wide open .
sorrell explains : there is all to play for as we go into the election .
obviously it does increase uncertainty in the uk , it 's not good .
[ the question of ] what is our position in relation to the european market , to the eu ? ''
is an added uncertainty .
those fears around brexit will escalate as we mover closer to 2017 when the in/out referendum will take place ( assuming the conservatives form the next government ) , he added .
the debates will start with regard to our role , or non-role '' , in europe closer to that time , sorrell says .
hugo dixon ( @ hugodixon ) tragedy that # hollande did n't appoint reform cabinet when elected two years ago

documents.title: wpp boss : russia has replaced eurozone as the main risk
text: sir martin sorrell reuters russia has replaced the eurozone as the major worry facing the global economy , wpp boss sir martin sorrell has warned .
sorrell says he met with fellow business leaders in geneva , and saw the geopolitics has raced up the agenda .
in an interview with reuters ( online here ) , sorrell explained : the eurozone was the big topic of conversation and concern this time last year .
this year it 's been replaced by the middle east , and in particular by russia and the impact of sanctions .
those sanctions will start to bite in the months ahead , and could have a knock-on effect on hurt businesses across europe .
the slowest growing region for wpp this year is western continental europe , sorrell says .
france , italy and spain all remain quite fragile .

and on france sorrell also says that the latest french political crisis show the tremendous political tensions '' between people who want more austerity and cost controls and those who want keynesian stimulus .

france is not complying with what brussels and mario draghi want in terms of budget control , sorrell concludes , contrasting it with britain , where the chancellor has done a great job '' and the economy is growing at 4 % '' .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) the ten year government bond yield in # germany is 0.94 % this morning # qe # euro
european government bonds are also strengthening in value this morning , driven by the prospect of an ecb qe programme .
yesterday 's fall in business confidence in germany is also pushing investors into safe-haven assets such as german bunds .
the yield , or interest rate , on german 10-year bunds has fallen to just 0.932 % today .
italian 10-year bond yields have dropped by 5 basis points , from 2.45 % to 2.4 % , and spanish yields are down a chunky 7 basis points to 2.19 % .
michael hewson of cmc markets explains how mario draghi 's speech on friday night is making waves .

draghi 's speech has been construed as a significant departure from the usual rhetoric usually used by ecb heads , in that he has ventured into areas normally reserved for politicians , and is particularly notable at a time when the political temperature in europe looks set to rise further in the wake of the collapse of the french government , which is under increasing pressure from brussels and berlin to get its spending under control .

despite these political concerns and yet another poor german ifo business confidence survey yesterday european stock markets rose sharply on monday as markets looked to price in the prospect of further policy easing by the ecb in an attempt to try and boost economic growth in the euro area .

documents.title: european market open
text: the london stock market is open after the long weekend , and staging a small rally .
mario draghi 's pledge to use all available instruments '' to help the eurozone is cheering the city .
the ftse 100 rose 39 points , or 0.55 % , at the start of trading to 6815 .
european markets are dipping a little , though , after yesterday 's big rally .
steve collins ( @ tradedesk steve ) big highlight was draghi on late friday : the speech described as possibly one of the landmarks in the ecb 's history .

documents.title: reuters : french pm to unveil pro-reform cabinet
text: reuters has a good piece on the french political crisis , sparked by the dismissal of economy minister ( and austerity critic ) arnaud montebourg : france 's prime minister will scramble to put together a new pro-reform government on tuesday , a day after the surprise eviction of rebel ministers who had opposed budgetary rigor .

manuel valls will seek as wide a basis as possible for his second cabinet in five months ahead of tough negotiations at home and with eu peers on france 's 2015 budget and he is expected to try to poach politicians from other parties .
economists reckon valls ' new administration could benefit from a tighter focus on economic plans ; at a time when france is struggling to grow , and missing the budget targets agreed with brussels .

an unrepentant montebourg , though , repeated his call for a new plan last night , telling reporters : the whole world is begging us to put an end to these absurd austerity policies which are burying the euro zone deeper and deeper in recession and which will soon end up with deflation .

david jones ( @ jonesthemarkets ) ftse100 set to play catch up this morning after another strong us performance on monday .

documents.title: london stock market to play catch-up
text: federal reserve chair janet yellen , right , and european central bank president mario draghi walking together during the jackson hole economic policy symposium last friday .
locher/ap good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the financial markets , the economy , the eurozone and business .

the london stock market is expected to rise this morning as investors respond to the prospect of fresh stimulus measures from the european central bank to help the struggling eurozone economy and fight deflation .
city traders meandering back to their desks after a soggy bank holiday missed yesterday 's strong rally in other european markets , which saw the french cac surge over 2 % .
they 're likely to push the ftse 100 up by around 35 points , back over the 6,800 mark .
paul kavanagh ( @ kavanaghkillik ) # ftse100 futures indicating a 35 point higher opening .
mario draghi 's speech last friday does appear to be another significant moment in the crisis .
the ecb chief 's pledge to use all available instruments '' is seen as a prelude to a quantitative easing programme ( qe ) from europe 's central bank .
this prospect rippled as far as wall street , helping to push pushed the s & p 500 index over the 2000 point mark for the first time ever last night .
and the euro is hovering near its lowest level in a year , at $ 1.32 to the dollar .
stan shamu of ig explains : driving sentiment across the globe at the moment are bets we will see further stimulus from some of the major central banks .
in european trade [ yesterday ] investors responded to mario draghi 's comments from the weekend in an overwhelmingly positive way and euro weakness helped to give equities an extra kicker .
a qe programme ( buying assets with newly minted money ) would n't actually drag the eurozone out of its low-growth , low-inflation torpor on its own , mind you .

and that 's why mario draghi also called for more growth-friendly fiscal policies last friday ; a hot topic right now in france , where the government resigned yesterday as a row over its austerity programme erupted .
jose miguel sardo ( @ jmsardo ) # france : the same headline on liberation and le figaro on the government crisis .
france thrown into political turmoil after government dissolved president holland has ordered prime minister manuel valls to form a new cabinet consistent with the direction set for the country '' .
we should get details later today .
investors will also be watching the talks between ukrainian president petro poroshenko and russia 's vladimir putin , at a summit in minsk today .
otherwise , it 's a fairly quiet day , until a splurge of us economic data this afternoon - including durable goods sales at 1.30pm , and consumer confidence survey at 3pm .
